meta_title: Days Of Lot 2021: Shocking Apostasy in the Church
title: Days Of Lot 2021: Shocking Apostasy in the Church

body:
didn't watch video but wanted to comment on one confusing semantics point in the title:

apostasy doesn't happen "in" the Church, apostates are no longer "in" the Church (right?)

so rather apostasy would happen "from" the Church

This use of words is important to me because people say so and so is an apostate and at the same time acts like they are Christian, rather than considering such a person and/or the church they're a part of to not be Christian anymore (I have frequently even seen people who hold to these kinds of viewpoints describing the people they disagree with as such, and I think it is important to clearly visualize this)
body_html:
didn't watch video but wanted to comment on one confusing semantics point in the title:

apostasy doesn't happen "in" the Church, apostates are no longer "in" the Church (right?)

so rather apostasy would happen "from" the Church

This use of words is important to me because people say so and so is an apostate and at the same time acts like they are Christian, rather than considering such a person and/or the church they're a part of to not be Christian anymore (I have frequently even seen people who hold to these kinds of viewpoints describing the people they disagree with as such, and I think it is important to clearly visualize this)

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: I don't understand what is apparently so important about something that is mentioned less than five times in the entire bible.

body: This seems to be one of, if not *the* most important issue to everyone. Everything else is brushed off and excused but this is apparently the thing that's unacceptable and ranted about 24/7, to the same extent that the media shoves it down your throat and forces you to like it. I would think if it was really *that* central there would be a LOT more written on the topic prior to the last couple of centuries, and Jesus would've actually brought it up or something.

Everything else is brushed off and excused but this is apparently the thing that's unacceptable and ranted about 24/7, to the same extent that the media shoves it down your throat and forces you to like it.
